item.title: Robot Platform Software Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position: Robot Platform Software Developer Co-op (Spring 2023)
Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Education: Currently pursuing a Post-Secondary degree in Mechatronics / Systems / Computer / Electrical Engineering
Division: OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Inc.
Clearpath Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors
OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com

About the Job
As a member of the Platform Software team, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between hardware and software in mobile autonomous vehicles. We’re focused on creating reliable and verifiable robot hardware systems to enable the latest and greatest robot A.I.

You’ll get the chance to work with real hardware while still being focused on developing modern real-time software. You will help create advanced technologies and methodologies to validate complicated mechatronic systems.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Developing a software framework for testing software-controlled electronics
  • Writing, executing, and debugging tests to validate safety-critical systems
  • Debugging issues from customers to figure out why robots stopped doing their jobs
  • Documenting development and debugging activities
  • Additional Responsibilities may include:
  • Developing tools to analyze and debug robot behaviour
  • Reviewing existing and new software source code
  • Collaborating with other engineering teams to validate complex requirements
About You
You like software that controls machinery. Your debugging skills are just as refined as your programming skills. Real world applications are more important to you than theory. You’re interested in creating systems for robotics in the industrial, aerospace, or automotive industries.

Required Experience & Skills
  • Software development using Python, C++
  • Proficiency with Linux (especially Ubuntu)
  • Prototyping electronic circuits on breadboards
  • Analyzing circuitry using multimeters and oscilloscopes
  • Bonus Experience & Skills
  • Familiarity with ROS
  • Version control software (git, svn)
  • Executing and analyzing automated tests
  • Firmware development and debugging
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Autonomy Engineer - Multi-agent Navigation
item.description:
Description

Position:            Autonomy Engineer- Multi-agent-Navigation         
Location:           Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual, Canada 
Job Type:          Full-Time, Permanent
Experience:      2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:        Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms for navigation, collaboration, and control - all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the core software for fleets of multi-ton robots, find optimal routes through the most complex work environments around the world, and safely balance millimeter tracking accuracy with maximum driving performance.

The navigation team’s primary responsibility is robotics software development, testing, and support. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve our self-driving capabilities, selecting the best research and/or industry algorithms to employ, and developing high-performance implementations that expand our core autonomy software. As part of the team, your input will be integral for reviewing and supporting the designs, implementations, and tests developed by other autonomy engineers. Finally, as part of OTTO, we work closely with both industry and academia, where you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with our partners and see your ideas making a measurable difference in the world.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Developing collaboration, navigation, and control software
  • Testing/reviewing software for reliability/performance
  • Conducting research projects to expand our capabilities
  • Supporting deployment, product, and testing teams

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaborating with academic/industry partners
  • Mentoring and assisting with supervision of interns
  • Writing research papers for academic publication
  • Explaining our newest shiny toys to sales & marketing

About You

You want to work for a company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, here to make a difference, and never satisfied with work left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and thrive on challenging, rewarding problems.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Graduate degree in engineering or a related field, with applicable background
  • Practical knowledge in two or more areas of: path planning, motion planning, mobile robot control, vehicle modelling, and multi-agent systems
  • Strong software development skills in Modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Hands-on experience with autonomous systems

Desired Soft Skills:

  • Ability to efficiently and clearly communicate ideas, including to those who may have a limited theoretical background in the area
  • Ability to reliably plan and estimate development time requirements
  • A learning mindset and positive attitude
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines, job responsibilities, and the local gravity field

Bonus points for:

  • ROS experience
  • Strong Python / Lua skills
  • Experience with the control of differential drive, bicycle, and tricycle ground vehicles
  • Understanding of sensors and their error models, particularly laser rangefinders, GPS systems, and vision systems


At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Director, Development Operations (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

Position:         Director, Development Operations
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    12+ years
Education:      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The DevOps Team is in need of an experienced manager to help drive and maintain the continuous integration experience.  The team is tasked with ensuring that the full lifecycle of development from source submission to release is fully automated.  The team handles all aspects of the development environment and workflow; build, automated testing platforms, deployment and a full simulation stack.  We develop testing platforms so that other teams can be empowered to write automated tests.  Your day will be split between managerial and supporting development tasks.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Identify areas of improvement within the CI processes.
  • Delegate, schedule and manage tasks within the DevOps Domain (Sprint and Long-term).
  • Lead and grow a team of highly skilled developers.
  • Collaborate with other teams to determine needs and gaps.
  • Be an ambassador for quality initiatives to ensure that all teams are producing a high-quality product.  
  • Maintain and develop DevOps toolchains and automated processes.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required skills and experience:

  • Minimum 3 Years of experience managing a technical team.
  • Minimum 5 Years experience with DevOps/Continuous Integration processes.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Python Programming or other relevant scripting language.
  • Docker, Kubernetes, VMware or other container or virtualization products
  • Maintaining and developing a job management system (Jenkins, groovy).
  • Source Control software (Git) and knowledge of best practices
  • Experience automating workflows or providing devOps toolchains.
  • Experience developing and administering solutions with AWS tools/technologies

Bonus skills:

  • Experience with test infrastructure or automated test frameworks.
  • Experience working in the robotics industry or knowledge of ROS.
  • Experience working with simulation tool chains (Gazebo)
  • Experience with cloud providers beyond AWS
  • Experience with python and debian packaging 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping
item.description:
Description

Position:                  Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping               
Location:                 Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:                Full-Time Permanent
Experience:            5-10 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:              Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:                OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful, motivated candidate for the Perception Team Lead position. This person will lead a team of developers to create and maintain the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, state estimation, computer vision and more.

The localization and mapping team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception, mapping and localization on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. As part of the perception team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

About You

For the role of Perception Team Lead we are seeking an experienced developer and leader to drive the development of state-of-the-art localization and mapping solutions for real world applications.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Lead a team of exceptional perception developers to create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, localization, computer vision, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new algorithms and sensing technology
  • Assisting with concept development for new products and projects
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Supervising and mentoring team members
  • Collaboration with internal teams including controls and navigation, as well as academic and industrial partners
  • Stay up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry

Skills and experience:

  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field
  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, localization, mapping, or sensor modeling.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
  • Excellent leadership, teamwork, and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including scope, timelines, resource estimates, and test procedures.

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience with leading software development teams.
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:      Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer
Location:      Kitchener, Ontario
Job Type:      Full-Time Permanent
Experience:   3+ years
Education:     Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics, Systems, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

The Platform team is responsible for integrating the Hardware and Software of OTTO Mobile Autonomous Robot platforms.  You are a true Mechatronics engineer, with a focus primarily on the software side of things including bare metal firmware, device drivers for external components, and application layer components. You will lead in developing the software components to make our robots function, and easily diagnose issues. You will exemplify a proper Software Development Life Cycle from beginning to end and contribute to every aspect of it. Your code will ultimately run on the robots and control mission-critical functionality such as battery management, sensor drivers or motor command output. Any failure could have catastrophic consequences. 

You will be involved with the initial proof of concept and bring-up of new robot hardware platforms, integrating the hardware with the autonomous software.  You will be responsible for the controls system architecture and design of new and existing industrial self-driving vehicles.  Design challenges will span from high-level system architecture, integration, programming, and field testing. You have no problem deducing hardware issues from software logs. You will need to be aware of functional safety implications in an industrial environment, and how to implement and verify safety functions. 

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Architect, design and implement custom software, ranging from low-level robot control firmware, PC drivers for external controllers, and enhanced interactive diagnostics using C/C++ and Python
  • Prototyping and Bring-up of new Mechatronic platforms
  • Integrating complex electronics and control systems with Autonomous Software
  • Documentation of system-level architectures, and contributing to knowledge bases for triaging and debugging complex issues
  • Coordination of feature requirements between Software, Hardware, and Production teams
  • Providing expert level debugging of our robots to support Client Success, Field Services, and internal Test and Manufacturing teams

 

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with applicable background
  • 3+ years of experience working with C++ and/or Python
  • Experience writing robust, efficient, high performance code
  • Strong electronics and mechatronics prototyping and debugging skills (breadboarding, oscilloscopes, multimeters)
  • Experience of hands-on troubleshooting of electronic and electromechanical systems
  • Understanding of sensors and actuators and their error modes, especially motor controllers
  • Able to perform root-cause analysis of hardware and software issues from data logs
  • Familiarity with Linux (Debian based distributions)
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures
  • Past experience participating in development or deployment projects that have gone terribly wrong

 

Bonus Skills:

  • Knowledge of different approaches to the Software Development Lifecycle, especially the V-model
  • IT experience in networking, OS configuration and troubleshooting, drivers
  • Experience working with different field buses, especially CAN and Ethernet-based
  • Experience with industrial electrical design and troubleshooting
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles, such as AGVs, AMRs, SDVs, forklifts, tuggers etc.
  • Experience with ROS (Robot Operating System)
  • Familiarity with software version control and CI/CD tools, such as Git, Jenkins and Gitlab
  • P.Eng Accreditation attained or in-progress

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Autonomy Developer - Calibration and Sensors
item.description:
Description

Position: Senior Autonomy Developer - Calibration and Sensors              
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Masters or PhD Degree in a related field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Perception Developer to work on the Perception Team in the Vehicle Software Group to focus on the development of sensor calibration algorithms.

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, calibration, sensing, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors you will develop & maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration of robotic systems and processing of sensor data. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

About You

For the role of Perception Developer - Calibration we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for a variety of applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Development of custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Work with production to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in industry and academia 

Skills and experience:

  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux environment

Bonus Points For:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Proficiency with linear algebra and non-linear optimization including libraries such as ceres solver and Eigen
  • Experience with computer vision libraries such as PCL and OpenCV.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

 

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Simulation Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:         Simulation Developer          
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    2 - 5 years of relevant work experience
Education:      Degree in a related field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Staff Software Developer (Fleet Manager)
item.description:
Description

Position:         Staff Software Developer (Fleet Manager)
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent       
Experience:   8+ Years of relevant Software Development related experience
Education:     Post-Secondary degree or diploma in Computer Systems Technology or related field
Division:       OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are looking for a Staff Software Developer to work on the Fleet Core team as part of the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development, and support.

Reliable robot hardware needs reliable software, including Fleet Management. We are looking for a Staff Software Developer who can bring experienced software development experience and leadership to help us define, implement and deliver innovative solutions for our customers.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Solve technical problems of the highest scope and complexity for your team.
  • Advocate for improvements to product quality, and performance that have particular impact across your team and others.
  • Actively seek out difficult impediments to our efficiency as a team ("technical debt"), propose and implement solutions that will enable the entire team to iterate faster.
  • Drive innovation on the team with a willingness to experiment and to boldly confront problems of immense complexity and scope.
  • Exert significant influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team. 
  • Contribute to and extend documentation and materials to empower users of our Fleet Management solutions.
  • Provide mentorship for all members in the team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
  • Confidently ship large features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the teams outside of the Fleet Group on larger projects.

About You

You want to work for a fast-paced company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. As a Staff Software Developer you have delivered and supported software deployed for customers on the other side of the world. You know the ins and outs of the Software Development Life Cycle and strive to automate whatever you can along the way. You keep on top of the latest technologies and are not satisfied with “because we always did it that way”. You’re also an excellent communicator and team player with demonstrated leadership skills. You can clearly explain the merits of a solution to other developers and managers. You’ve got a real knack for coming up with solutions that make (and keep) people happy.

Required Experience/Skills

  • Post-secondary diploma in Software Development or related field
  • 8+ years Software Development experience
  • Strong Object Oriented Programming experience (Python, C++)
  • Strong bash or other shell scripting languages
  • Experience developing software with data persistence layer (SQL)
  • SCM experience (git, Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket, SVN, etc.)
  • Experience with ticket and content management systems (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) 
  • Experience clearly and concisely communicating complex technical and architectural problems and proposing iterative solutions (LucidChart, Visio, etc.)

Bonus Skills

  • Experience developing ROS applications
  • Experience working with container frameworks (Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)
  • Experience with database object relational mapping libraries (Django, etc.)
  • Experience with CMake, make or other software build solutions
  • Experience with Nix package management
  • Debian based Linux skills - package management and configuration
  • Experience with data analytics and presentation tools (Grafana/Prometheus, Kibana/Elastic, etc.)
  • Experience configuring or deploying web based applications
  • Postgres or other database administration and/or integration experience

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Vehicle Integration Engineer (Developer Relations)
item.description:
Description

Position:     Vehicle Integration Engineer (Developer Relations)
Location:     Kitchener, ON
Job Type:     Full-Time Permanent
Experience:  2-5 years
Education:    Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial  Controls/Mechatronics/Computers/Systems Engineering or related field
Division:      OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Developer Relations team is at the heart of OTTO’s mission to integrate our software solution for Autonomous Navigation onto other vehicles to create new Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs). As a member of the Developer Relations team, you will be acting as prime for the technical execution. This includes coordinating engineering efforts across teams and working with Partners and Stakeholders to ensure successful integration of new vehicles.

You are a multidisciplinary engineer with strong organization & communication skills (verbal, written & diagrams) who enjoys working hands-on with hardware & software, as well as working at a higher architectural conceptual level. You demonstrate Systems Thinking; starting with “Why”, you are able to decompose complex problems into manageable tasks to be planned & executed.

Your core responsibilities will include:

  • Technical Lead for projects integrating OTTO Navigation Software onto 3rd Party Vehicle hardware 
  • Collaborate with Program Management to define & track work to be completed 
  • Guide 3rd party vehicle manufacturer into developing Autonomous Navigation ready hardware
  • Work closely with highly technical engineering teams & stakeholders to anticipate and address technical challenges
  • Create & Maintain System documentation and diagrams, such as Architecture, Interfaces, Sequences & State diagrams to establish context and understanding of the design

Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Provide System Requirements for software feature development
  • Create & Run simulations of AMRs using Gazebo and AWS
  • Plan & Execute demos/pilots with prototype vehicles at customer sites
  • Participate in design & architecture reviews
  • Assess Partner Vehicle’s Safety 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Proficiency with Linux Operating Systems (Ubuntu)
  • Programming in at least one of Python, C, C++
  • Designing System Architecture
  • Risk Assessment/FMEAs

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity with ROS
  • Experience with Fieldbus Communication Protocols (CAN/Modbus/EthernetIP)
  • Industrial Automation and/or PLCs (Siemens)
  • Experience working with APIs
  • Lucidcharts and/or other UML/SysML tools for creating diagrams
  • Knowledge of Relevant Safety & AMR Standards (ISO12100, ISO13849, ISO3691-4, R15.08)
  • Experience with Safety Critical Systems
  • Experience with the V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies
  • Project Management

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position: Robot Builder

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Client Success Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:               Client Success Manager            
Location:               Kitchener, ON or Remote/Virtual, Canada                       
Experience:          10+ years’ experience
Job Type:              Full-Time Permanent     
Education:            Degree in relevant field
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Client Success Manager (CSM) role is responsible for nurturing client relationships and helping our clients realize value through rapid adoption and ongoing use of our solution.  CSM’s are the relationship leaders that secure long-term relationships, drive adoption of OTTO Motors’ solutions, team up with Account Executives to upsell new products and services, drive customer relationships and loyalty, and are highly motivated to provide our clients with the absolute best in service and support.  

This is a great opportunity for a creative, energetic thinker, able to understand the client’s business needs and use cases and know how to be a trusted partner so our clients stay and continue to grow with OTTO Motors. If you love working with customers and have thrived in a role like this before, then we want to talk to you.

Core Competencies

  • Accountability
  • Adaptability
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Helps customers to realize and maximize the full value of their in-production systems
  • Accountable for maintaining a stable of client relationships
  • Captures opportunities to increase profitable revenue growth within existing OTTO Motors’ sites through increasing demand for existing services or by introducing new services in partnership with Account Executives
  • Meets with customers regularly to review support and system performance that demonstrates health, production, and value of system
  • Owns support renewals for assigned accounts
  • Works with internal teams to drive customer satisfaction (servers as a voice of the customer within the organization)
  • Lead onboarding for new support customers (transition from project teams to support team)
  • Identifies and provides (or sets up) customer training
  • Identifies changes that the customer has made to their system and coordinates updating the support team
  • Work with our internal teams to ensure alignment and provide a cohesive experience. When necessary, you will act as the point of support account escalation to help drive resolution to high impact or long-term customer issues
  • Your metrics: Adoption Rate, Customer Lifetime Value, Net Promoter Score, Churn Rate, and CSAT
  • This role involves regular travel to customer sites across North America (approx. 4 times a quarter - short visits)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

You possess a natural affinity with people, the ability to listen to the customer’s needs, a large amount of common sense and business acumen, which will allow you to successfully manage, sell and handle a dynamic changing market.

Required skills:

  • BA/BS degree, Technology related diploma, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of 3 - 5 years of Project Management, Technical Support leadership, Technical Consultant, or Customer Success experience
  • Strong people management and relationship management skills
  • Exceptional planning and organizing skills
  • Self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption
  • Personable, with strong communication skills
  • Proven selling, influencing, persuasion and negotiation skills
  • Strong self-initiative and results orientation
  • Excellent attention to detail, able to work under pressure and multi-task

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Quality Generalist
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:       Quality Generalist

Location:      Waterloo, Ontario         

Experience:   3+ yrs relevant work experience

Education:    Diploma in a related field 

Division:       Clearpath Robotics

About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

We require an organized individual to assist with inspection and testing of a variety of made to spec.components, to assist with analysis on issued MTS/OTS parts and to communicate solutions to all vested parties. We need a Quality Generalist to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Incoming quality inspection of made to spec.parts
  • Testing and troubleshooting of PCBAs and Electrical Harnesses
  • Assist in the creation of NCR’s and document issues learned from your diagnosis.
  • Process/Traceability documentation

Additional tasks may include:

  • Process implementation and refinement
  • Review and consult our FQC testing
  • Participating in Continuous Improvement and 5S activities

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required Technical Skills:

  • Ability to read a schematic, identify mechanical/electrical components and determine root cause of PCB or robot test failures
  • Ability to take precise mechanical measurements and evaluate if they are within acceptable tolerances
  • Practical understanding of mechanical/electrical defects
  • Practical understanding of cable assembly, PCBA quality standards and common defects
  • Experiencing working with ERP systems

Bonus points for:

  • Any of IPC-7711, IPC-7721, IPC-A-600, IPC-9121, IPC-610, IPC-A-620 training or equivalent
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Familiarity with ISO standards
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • 5S methodology

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Field Services Technician
item.description:
Description

Position:        Field Service Technician              
Location:       Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:      Full-Time Permanent
Experience:   0-3 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:    Undergraduate degree or college diploma in a related field
Division:        OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We believe in providing our clients with the specific solutions to their problems. We’re shipping large, complex industrial mobile robotics platforms that require a skilled integrator to troubleshoot, repair and maintain them in the field.

 

As a Field Services Technician, you will be responsible for all things hardware.  You will provide on-site and remote advanced repair and troubleshooting, provide repair and maintenance training to customers, generate repair and maintenance procedures and manuals and trial new retrofits and recalls.

Your goal is to efficiently return customer systems to operation and minimize downtime experienced.

You will receive support from the rest of the OTTO Motors production, engineering, and operations teams to ensure that your work is streamlined. You will also provide feedback to the team regarding cost and complexity as necessary. 

  • Support and repair existing customer deployments (requires traveling to customer location)
  • Audit systems to verify optimal functionality (hardware preventative maintenance, network audits, user interactions, etc.)
  • Provide clear and concise feedback to internal teams to continually improve our products and focus our offerings.
  • Review customer workflow, software and database systems


About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. You look forward to traveling around the globe, expanding Clearpath and OTTO Motors’ robot domain.

You like the thought of working on projects that interact with the world, even more so when they can do so on their own. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day. You like tackling new problems and learning as you go.

You are comfortable working remotely, interfacing with your company and customers via web conferencing, phone, IM and e-mail communication.

You are a self-starter.  You do not need to be micro-managed and are looking to be given goals and tasks that you will follow through to completion on your own while providing feedback and updates on status.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Exceptional professionalism and client-facing skills (frequent interaction with customers required)
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Electrical system debugging and repair
  • Mechanical aptitude and experience working with your hands
  • Software system integration and system debugging
  • Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
  • Detail oriented, excellent written and verbal communication

Bonus points for:

  • Linux (Ubuntu)
  • ROS
  • C, C++, Python
  • Comptia, A+
  • Comptia Network+
  • Experience troubleshooting Networking and Wireless issues
  • Experience working with complex linked systems

*Candidate must be able to travel to US immediately so should have a valid visa or residency status.

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Project Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:              Senior Project Manager           
Location:             Kitchener, ON
Job Type:             Full Time Permanent           
Experience:         7+Years relevant experience
Education:           BS or MSc Degree in Engineering, or similar technical field in an Engineering discipline
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.


About the Job

We are shipping more and more robots and are taking on bigger and better contracts. We are delivering more and more integrated solutions, including operational and support services through Managed Services approaches. We need someone to help our existing project management team to take our Managed Services projects from original concept through to final implementation, and subsequently ongoing operations and maintenance support to achieve customer operational performance guarantees.

As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating project deliverables and serving as the point of contact between customers, subcontractors and internal departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members and vendors to ensure our projects are delivered on time and ensuring our customers’ needs are met at go live and throughout the operational use of or solutions.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Responsible for identifying project scope, assign individual responsibilities, identify resources needed, and develop a schedule to ensure timely completion of project and delivery.
  • Lead, organize, manage and motivate the project team and develop effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Act as the primary interface with Customer project as well as operations management; build close cooperative relationships with Customers, focused on long term partnerships.
  • Manage subcontractors and vendors to ensure on time delivery in line with agreed scope of work within agreed budget.
  • Ensure management of the operational steady state phase of our solutions at our Customer to ensure our customers business objectives and service levels are achieved, including management of operational escalations.
  • Develop detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports.
  • Conduct project meetings and take responsibility for project tracking and analysis.
  • Responsible for and manage cost, cashflow, schedule, scope and risk management. Responsible for overall profit of project as well as customer satisfaction.
  • Act as the point person for changes, updates, questions, and issues. Identify and pursue opportunities
  • Identify and communicate vital information to the design team and the company
  • Shape and impact processes; 
  • Think ahead to raise and examine problems and propose possible solutions

 About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

As our next Senior Project Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and be a world-class juggler… with projects and deadlines that is.  You have exceptional project and contract management experience from previous work placements. You have the experience and ability to manage to ensure our solutions, once delivered, are operating and being maintained in a way that ensures business continuity and performance of customer mission critical automated processes.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • BS or MSc Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical field  in an Engineering discipline. Additional education in business administration, finance, operations, or project management an asset.
  • 10+ years of project management experience in a dynamic environment with multi-disciplined technical team members, demonstrating increasing levels of project value and complexity in automated material handling industry
  • Experience managing complex groups of stakeholders, including large customer organizations as well as subcontractors and vendors. 
  • Leadership capability to create and manage a unified and motivated project team
  • Unusually strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once, while still paying attention to detail
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project and other project management tools
  • A strong work ethic and self-starter attitude, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication, with the ability to build long term relationships/partnerships
  • Drive for continuous improvement

Bonus Points For:

  • Mechatronics background and experience with Automated Controls Systems. 
  • Optional: Engineering Technologist degree.
  • Experience within field of automated material handling. 
  • Experience in managing operations and maintenance of mission critical manufacturing or material handling environments with mechanical, electrical, software and IT components.
  • PMP certification/accreditation
  • Experience with RaaS, BPO or managed services type of contracts.
  • Proficiency in Epicor
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience
  • knowledge of contract law, along with negotiation skills
  • Willing and able to travel internationally (especially US).

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Deployment Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:         Project Engineer / Technical Deployment Specialist
Location:        Kitchener, ON
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    3-5 years
Education:     College Diploma or Bachelors in relevant field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com. 

About the Job

The primary objective of the Technical Deployment Specialist (TDS) role is to act as the technical coordinator for a project during the deployment phase, and support to the operations during the managed services phase. Reporting to the General Manager Managed, the Technical Deployment Specialist works closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) and Systems Engineers (SE’s) to understand and lead the technical aspects of a project. The Technical Deployment Specialist tracks and resolves technical issues and acts as Tier 1 support for both the Project Manager and the Systems Engineer (SE) assigned to the project, as well as coordinates on product level with internal departments and subcontractors. The Technical Deployment Specialist is the technical bridge/universal translator between the Project Deployment team and the OTTO Motors Engineering team.

 Primary responsibilities include:

  • Supplement the project ‘voice of the customer’ at the technical level to the internal product organization and towards subcontractors and interact effectively with varied departments.
  • Work with the Project Managers and Systems Engineers to plan and deploy projects after receiving a PO and leading up to and including a Site Acceptance Test.
  • Gain a broad exposure to all aspects of the OTTO Motors technology (AMR SW, AMR HW, Infrastructure (Fleet Manager SW, IT policies, Networking), Product capabilities/limitations, and best practices for all current and recent past products.)
  • Coordinate with subcontractors on a technical level to translate customer requirements into technical design specifications, testing criteria and successful delivery of technological solution by subcontractors.
  • Coordinate timely supply of products to customer site from internal organization and from subcontractors.
  • Gain a working knowledge of the processes and workflows of the PMO and those of other OTTO Motors teams.
  • Have a familiarity with and understand the principal functions of all information systems used at OTTO Motors such as: Epicor, Jira, Salesforce, Elastic/Kibana, Wiki, Google Suite, OTTO Motors Knowledge Base, Arena/PLM.
  • Pre-configure Fleet Manager OVA\'s (installation files) for deployment at customer sites and assist with issues arising during the installation process.
  • Act as primary IT/network SME on active deployments and assigned upgrades.
  • Troubleshoot issues with any of the aforementioned topics quickly and effectively, escalating in a timely manner when an issue requires a solution from a SME.
  • Coordinate handling of issues and quality defects in case support required from internal suppliers or external subcontractors
  • Assist with robot diagnostic data collection and primary triage for root cause analysis or escalation to Tier III or Tier IV support.
  • Reduce the number of \'direct-to-engineering\' escalations arising from on-site issues; this lets the developers focus on new features without getting distracted by minor issues.
  • Collaborate with OTTO Motors Engineering and subcontractors to troubleshoot product related project issues.
  • Keep track of the state of multiple project assignments at any given time, and maintain information records for each, during the full lifetime of the contract.
  • Self-prioritize workloads, often when under multiple \'crisis\' situations at customer sites.
  • Communicate effectively with SMEs, other OTTO Motors employees (of varying levels of technical expertise), as well as with subcontractors and with the customer.
  • Translating high-level technical concepts into easy-to-understand terms.
  • Prepare technical documentation about each deployment to facilitate the transition from the deployment phase to the support phase.
  • Understand the product capabilities and limitations and explain the context of each to different parties, including internal to OTTO Motors.

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 Desired skills:

  • 3-5 years of relevant experience in a technical customer-facing role
  • Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in engineering or other technical field
  • Excellent organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and analyze difficult issues
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced high mix low volume environment
  • Ability to work unsupervised while still effectively achieving goals
  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new skills and tools
  • Background or exposure to an industrial automation environment
  • Proven ability to work cooperatively with others in a team environment
  • Ability to work effectively with internal departments and/or subcontractors
  • Technical writing/communication

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating Shifts)
item.description:

Location:     Kitchener
Job  Type:    Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ years customer-facing work experience
Education:   Bachelors in related field
Division:      OTTO Motors
